text: And I love Arcade Fire and The Shins (they're actually my favorite bands) that definitely reach deeper than some other stuff, but has anything ever hit as hard as Smells Like Teen Spirit or Jeremy (and the like) since? Or is it just because thats when I grew up?

Sincere question with no judgement: I came of age in the 90s with musical options that at first (they'd later become a parody of themselves) really spoke to something deeper that hadn't been explored and previously had been painted over. Does such new music exist today?
